intro: Borreria kappleriana, commonly known as the Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Borreria kappleriana is typically found in dry, open habitats such as rocky slopes and woodlands.
